alert.note: Alert for Calcasieu (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 6:35PM CDT until July 10 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Calcasieu Parish in southwestern Louisiana... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 635 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lake Charles, Iowa, Moss Bluff and Lebleu Settlement. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
